title: Kha is pretty gross right now.
body: The amount of damage he does and lock down he has when counter jungling is insane. if you're a jungler that doesn't have an extremely reliable escape or just one with a bad early game playing against kha right now is a nightmare. 80% isolation slow, insane damage. and if you're a mage like {{champion:161}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:34}} that typically uses 1 cc move to stop an assassin from moving so you can NOT die you might as well just hug tower or whatever tank you have because with {{item:3814}} and his new ult good fucking luck not getting deleted by him. add in {{item:3147}} and you pretty much have to be with your team preferably next to the {{champion:40}} at all times if you don't wanna get surprised butt touched.

replies.body: I haven't had that experience. The one Kha I played with was way, way ahead, and I was still able to fight him reasonably as the adc. I think he was 7/1 and I was 3/1 or something. I am happy, in general, with the way things turned out. While it's likely that any given champ is a little strong or a little weak, it seems to me like the goals of having counterplay to assassins have hit the mark.
As a Plat Kha main, he is actually weaker than he was. Despite number increases, until someone finds an efficient playstyle he will be messy.

From what I've experience so far, it feels like his raw damage has gone down slightly, but he feels like he has massively increased variability.

That increase makes fighting him (currently) a nightmare
how is he weaker? his ult is legitamently really good right now, his slow and cd reduction on isolated targets makes it nearly impossible to fight him 1v1 unless really ahead.

I think it's more he's not weak per se, but there lot's of things he wants to build and as a result suffers because there really is no proper way to play him. 

Well, at least that's how I took his comment.

honestly i think that makes him STRONGER  like you can build a bunch of versatile shit on him. you could go more fighter with like a {{item:3814}}  {{item:3071}} {{item:1400}} and then some optional  items depending on the situation or a full one shot build with {{item:3074}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3142}}. you have way more options now and thats super horrifying. not only that but if say kha is ahead and the only person on the enemy team to contest him is ap. {{item:3814}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3111}} have fucking fun bruh.
why do silvers make post about balance ,

i'm not silver but okay, lets just judge shit by rank and not by the actual validity of their arguements. so if a challenger player says {{champion:86}} full ap is good, then it must be... cause a challenger player said it.

I main kha'zix, and sadly i have to agree with this :/
he was gross before the update and it was undoubtedly a buff.
Agreed, for a few months now he has been a %%%%

IMO he has too much stealth. They gave him true invisibility, free invis in bushes, and on top of that gave him more damage too. Like why.....he could already 1 shot well enough before. His old ult stealth was pretty meh, but now that you can't reveal with pinks, it's pretty overkill to give him free stealth in bushes AND movespeed on top of his 5,000 yard leap

Seriously, why?
